guiSET.core

Class MenuItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • guiSET.core.Control
      • guiSET.core.TextBased
        • guiSET.core.MenuItem
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ContextMenu, MenuSeparator, MenuTextbox

    public class MenuItem
extends TextBased
    Basic brick for creating menus. Just add a new MenuBar to your Frame instance and add MenuItems to it. You can add other MenuItems to these and so on to create any structure of menu items. Also take a look at the MenuSeparator which provides a non-clickable and slim line for separating parts of the menu strip. There is only this one class for every position in the menu tree. MenuItems and MenuStrips can also be used to create menus that pop up when i.e. right-clicking on something. This is accomplished by creating a ToolStrip and adding items to it. The ToolStrip can be be shown by calling myToolStrip.show().

      • MenuItem

        public MenuItem(java.lang.String text,
                java.lang.String selectCallback,
                Shortcut shortcut)
        Similar to MenuItem(String, String), but also provide a shortcut. The shortcut is displayed on the menu item and when this shortcut is hit on the keyboard, the callback is executed as if the menu item had been pressed.
        Parameters:
        text - text
        selectCallback - method name of callback for select event
        shortcut - shortcut

      • MenuItem

        public MenuItem(java.lang.String text,
                Control.Predicate selectCallback,
                Shortcut shortcut)
        Similar to #MenuItem(String, Predicate), but also provide a shortcut. The shortcut is displayed on the menu item and when this shortcut is hit on the keyboard, the callback is executed as if the menu item had been pressed.
        Parameters:
        text - text
        selectCallback - lambda callback for select event
        shortcut - shortcut

      • MenuItem

        public MenuItem(java.lang.String text,

                boolean strong)
        If strong set to true, then the shortcut might also be fired when a textbox has focus.
        Parameters:
        text - text
        methodName - method name
        shortcut - shortcut
        strong - strong property
